product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Age 13-17', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: I have been looking for this colour blush for so long! This is literally the best light pink natural-looking blush. It looks really light in the pan but it sits so pretty on the skin and sets into a really pretty pink colour.

product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is my first MUFE blush and it's really nice. It's not nearly as dark or bright as shown in the picture but it gives a pretty flush. The formula is buildable, easy to blend and has a satin finish without visible shimmer or glitter. I was hoping that it would have a stronger blue undertone but I'll definitely buy more colors when I can see them in store. **For reference, I wear NW10 in MAC, 1C0 Shell in ELDW and BR10 in YSL All Hours
…read more

product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I'm underwhelmed, and a bit confused, by this highlight. While I like that it's glitter free and blends easily, I'm not a fan of the color. The back pigment is pale pink, as described, but what's not mentioned is the odd peachy gold undertone or shift that's really unflattering on my NW10 skintone. I have a strong cool undertone and avoid warm tones because they give my skin a sickly green cast, and this highlight was no exception. I think someone that's also very fair but has a warm undertone may like this but I definitely recommend swatching it in store first.

product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content: The color is nice and it applies easily, blending very well. My issue with the product is that it has no lasting power. Even with Urban decays setting spray you can’t see the product about two hours after applying it. I wouldn’t buy again.

product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: The packaging is the cheapest ever! It comes in a black plastic bottom with a clear plastic cover! For $23 I could have bought something way better. You also have to apply the blush several times to even get some color. For the amount of money it costs, I recommend you choose another brand and don’t waste your hard earned money on this cheaply made product!

review_title: Perfect for a non-shimmery natural glow
review_content:
I LOVE this highlighter! I have very fair skin so I find it hard to find a highlighter that is subtle enough to look bright and natural instead of shimmery or ghostly. This one (in eggshell) does the job perfectly. I got it for the first time when I was 5 months pregnant (former highlighter ran out) and suddenly I started getting comments about how I was "glowing" and "radiant". Pretty sure it was not due to the pregnancy hormones and was all due to this highlighter! I also love it's ability to be stored in the solo case or in a custom palette case.

product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: FINALLY a contour that isn't orange on me
review_content:
I have looked for two years now for a powder contour that is cool toned enough for my pale skin. Everything I tried ends up just looking either really orange on me, or looks really dark and dirty. Because I am so incredibly pale, it took a long time to find something that works well and is light on the first application. S116 is the perfect one for me! The picture below is a finger swatch that I doubled up (applied, then recoated my finger and applied again on top) so that the colour would show up. it is buildable, but not too dark or harsh on the first application. It looked like it would be way too dark and muddy on me, but after trying it I realized that it is perfect for pale, cool-toned gals like me. If all of the contours you have tried look a little orange on you, try this one! Only downside is that you have to order a container for it, because this is ONLY the pan of product. But the refillable palettes they sell are really nice quality and are only $2. (The size small pallet is the one in my picture, and it fits one pan of this perfectly) I am SO HAPPY to finally have a contour powder that doesnt look orange or dirty on my face!

review_content:
Two words.. doesn't blend. I purchased two blushes and a highlighter to make my own kit. I thought it was a wonderful deal. First, the highlighter is extremely thick and cakey... Looks like a thick eyeshadow is on the cheek. Absolutely horrific looking. Second, the blushes are awful. They are very pigmented, but that's about it. They don't blend and are so patchy. Once you place the blush on your cheek, there is no blending and it won't move what so ever. You are stuck with that direct placement. I have tried so many times to make these products work but everytime I try it ends up messing up my makeup. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.

When I wear this, I look like I just came indoors from a snowstorm outside. I actually like this and apply it on a large area of my cheeks to look flushed. This big pan is going to last me forever.

product_name: MAKE UP FOR EVER Artist Face Color Highlight, Sculpt and Blush Powder
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_content:
Just a couple of days ago, I built my own face palette with a contour shade (S112) and a highlighter (H102), along with the S214 blush, which is what I am specifically reviewing, and I'm in love! The refillable palette looks and feels great, plus the mirror is relatively large. I'm very excited to use this when I'm away from home as it is such a great size and the colors are so easy to use and gorgeous. I have only used this on my skin without foundation so far and it blends out well and doesn't exaggerate my pores. I had a lot of fun in store choosing my colors and swatching the samples. I stood in front of the stand for at least twenty minutes just trying to figure out what I wanted for this little face palette because so many of the blushes were beautiful and the experience was so great. This is my first time purchasing Make Up For Ever products, although I do have a mini lipstick sample, and I'm so glad that this is my first real introduction to such an expansive brand. I will definitely be purchasing more blush shades as there were so many that I liked. Most likely, I will create a trio palette of just blush shades! While blush is one of my favorite products in general, the highlighter and contour shades that I chose are also beautiful and have a similar consistency that is easy to blend out. The highlighter I chose is relatively natural on my skin, which is what I generally look for in a highlighter. Overall, I absolutely would absolutely recommend the face palette bundle as it truly is such a great discount for products I am falling in love with.
